Project Portfolio

  • Data Structures

    For a data structures class, I was required to implement sorting algorithms and various data structures in Java from provided pseudocode. Some implementations include: RadixSort, InsertionSort, SinglyLinkedList, ArrrayBasedQueue, LinkedStack, SearchTableMap, LinkedBinaryTree, and EdgeListGraph.

  • Personal Website

    In the spirit of learning web development, I have created this website to act as my personal portfolio. It started as a simple Google site, but was eventually built from scratch using GitHub Pages. In its current state, this site is generated using the Jekyll static-site building framework, with custom HTML and CSS.

  • TI-84 Plus CE Development

    I challenged myself to create software for a development platform I was unfamiliar with. I chose a graphing calculator I owned, the TI-84 Plus CE. With its capability to run eZ80 Assembly with C support, I was able to learn fundamental software principles such as working with pointers, memory management, and developing software without the use of robust libraries.

  • Wordle in C

    During the 2022 Spring semester, I recreated The New York Times’ “Wordle” game in C . Instead of a web-based application, it was a C program designed to run in the terminal.
